com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.compute

Interface VirtualMachineOSImageOperations

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualMachineOSImageOperationsImpl

    public interface VirtualMachineOSImageOperations
    The Service Management API includes operations for managing the OS images in your subscription. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj157175.aspx for more information)

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • beginSharing

        OperationResponse beginSharing(java.lang.String imageName,
                             java.lang.String permission)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      ServiceException
        Share an already replicated OS image. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine image to share.
        permission - Required. The sharing permission: public, msdn, or private.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.

      • beginSharingAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<OperationResponse> beginSharingAsync(java.lang.String imageName,
                                                               java.lang.String permission)
        Share an already replicated OS image. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine image to share.
        permission - Required. The sharing permission: public, msdn, or private.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

      • beginUnreplicating

        OperationResponse beginUnreplicating(java.lang.String imageName)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            ServiceException
        Unreplicate an OS image to multiple target locations. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this. Note: The operation removes the published copies of the user OS Image. It does not remove the actual user OS Image. To remove the actual user OS Image, the publisher will have to call Delete OS Image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine image to replicate. Note: The OS Image Name should be the user OS Image, not the published name of the OS Image.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.

      • beginUnreplicatingAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<OperationResponse> beginUnreplicatingAsync(java.lang.String imageName)
        Unreplicate an OS image to multiple target locations. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this. Note: The operation removes the published copies of the user OS Image. It does not remove the actual user OS Image. To remove the actual user OS Image, the publisher will have to call Delete OS Image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine image to replicate. Note: The OS Image Name should be the user OS Image, not the published name of the OS Image.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

                                                  java.net.URISyntaxException
        The Create OS Image operation adds an operating system image that is stored in a storage account and is available from the image repository. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj157192.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        parameters - Required. Parameters supplied to the Create Virtual Machine Image operation.
        Returns:
        Parameters returned from the Create Virtual Machine Image operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity. Occasionally a method may wish to test whether the current thread has been interrupted, and if so, to immediately throw this exception. The following code can be used to achieve this effect:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - Thrown when attempting to retrieve the result of a task that aborted by throwing an exception. This exception can be inspected using the Throwable.getCause() method.
        ServiceException - Thrown if the server returned an error for the request.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error setting up tracing for the request.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was an error configuring the parser for the response body.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the response body.
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - Thrown if there was an error creating the DOM transformer.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • delete

        OperationResponse delete(java.lang.String imageName,
                       boolean deleteFromStorage)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                ServiceException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        The Delete OS Image operation deletes the specified OS image from your image repository. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj157203.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the image to delete.
        deleteFromStorage - Required. Specifies that the source blob for the image should also be deleted from storage.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity. Occasionally a method may wish to test whether the current thread has been interrupted, and if so, to immediately throw this exception. The following code can be used to achieve this effect:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - Thrown when attempting to retrieve the result of a task that aborted by throwing an exception. This exception can be inspected using the Throwable.getCause() method.
        ServiceException - Thrown if the server returned an error for the request.

      • deleteAsync

                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            ServiceException,
                                            javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                            org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        The Get OS Image operation retrieves the details for an operating system image from the image repository. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj157191.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the OS image to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A virtual machine image associated with your subscription.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.

        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • replicate

        VirtualMachineOSImageReplicateResponse replicate(java.lang.String imageName,
                                               VirtualMachineOSImageReplicateParameters parameters)
                                                 throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                                                        java.io.IOException,
                                                        ServiceException
        Replicate an OS image to multiple target locations. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine OS image to replicate.
        parameters - Required. Parameters supplied to the Replicate Virtual Machine Image operation.
        Returns:
        The response body contains the published name of the image.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was an error configuring the parser for the response body.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the response body.
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - Thrown if there was an error creating the DOM transformer.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.

        parameters - Required. Parameters supplied to the Replicate Virtual Machine Image operation.

      • share

        OperationStatusResponse share(java.lang.String imageName,
                            java.lang.String permission)
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                     java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                     ServiceException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Share an already replicated OS image. This operation is only for publishers. You have to be registered as image publisher with Windows Azure to be able to call this.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Required. The name of the virtual machine image to share.
        permission - Required. The sharing permission: public, msdn, or private.
        Returns:
        The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request and error information regarding the failure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity. Occasionally a method may wish to test whether the current thread has been interrupted, and if so, to immediately throw this exception. The following code can be used to achieve this effect:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - Thrown when attempting to retrieve the result of a task that aborted by throwing an exception. This exception can be inspected using the Throwable.getCause() method.
        ServiceException - Thrown if the server returned an error for the request.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error setting up tracing for the request.
